alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown; Florence; Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 12:53PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Florence, Georgetown, western Horry, southwestern Marion and eastern Williamsburg Counties through 145 PM EST... At 1252 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from Hyman to near Hannah to near Hemingway to near Morrisville to near Lambert. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Andrews, Johnsonville, Pamplico, Hemingway, North Santee, Rhems, Oatland, Poston, Nesmith, Brittons Neck, Sampit, Plantersville, Outland, Gresham, Earle, Morrisville, Henry, Warsaw and Hyman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for northeastern South Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Georgetown; Florence; Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg
